descriptionNullable:
Dataset of 720 aerial orthophotos of various environments classified into 5 categories by the level of clouds covering the area, and how much they actually obscure of the ground. Levels range from Very Low (anywhere between no clouds at all to a few wisps), to Very High (almost no ground features are visible due to the clouds in the area)

Source: Images were taken from a dataset found at: https://data.kitware.com/#collection/5f369a849014a6d84e76cef6/folder/5f369a8a9014a6d84e76cefe

Original images are of resolution between 3000x3000 to 3000x4000, and were divided into tiles of size 800x800. Each tile was labeled with the most relevant category (by my judgement), if you think some rating should be changed feel free to comment or message. Not all of the images from the dataset were used, as only a small fraction actually contained any clouds.

License: The original photos were published as Public, with no further information, however original photos were tagged for training geographical polygons.

Updates: (Dates in European format)
02-02-24 - Removed some NANs from CSV, removed some images that were absent from the CSV and inserted some as new photos to the database. Omitted 3 photos which were very very dark.
title: Cloud Coverage Classification
subtitle: Cloud coverage in Orthophotos
